DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess safety tolerability MP0112 ( novel , potentially long act VEGF inhibitor ) patient diabetic retinal edema .
DOC.brief_title: Study MP0112 Intravitreal Injection Patients With Diabetic Macular Edema
DOC.criteria: Male female age 18 year old Macular edema due diabetic retinopathy Bestcorrected visual acuity study eye 20/40 20/400 Central subfield thickness ≥ 250 micron OCT Females childbearing potential must negative serum pregnancy test Screening Male subject must : 1 ) surgically sterilize least 6 month , 2 ) use appropriate method barrier contraception ( e.g. , condom spermicide ) advise sexual partner childbearing potential must also use reliable method contraception ( e.g. , hormonal contraceptive , intrauterine device , diaphragm spermicide ) study 30 day study drug administration . Ability understand nature study give write informed consent Willing , commit , able return ALL clinic visit complete studyrelated procedure Any indication irreversible vision loss significant atrophy , scar , fibrosis , hyperpigmentation fovea Presence significant ocular abnormality study eye prevent retinal assessment , include medium opacity , cataract , inadequate papillary dilation Presence vision loss another ocular disease DME History intraocular surgery within 3 month Baseline History intraocular injection antiVEGF agent steroid within 3 month Baseline History laser photocoagulation macular edema within 4 month prior Baseline Uncontrolled hypertension > 140 systolic > 95 diastolic HbA1C ≥ 12 % Creatinine : > 1.5 x upper limit normal ( ULN ) Alanine transaminase ( ALT ) , aspartate transaminase ( AST ) , gammaglutamyl transferase ( GGT ) : > ULN White blood cell ( WBC ) , hematocrit , platelet : < low limit normal ( LLN ) Heart rate < 60 beat per minute ( bpm ) history clinically significant bradycardia History human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) , chronic hepatitis B , chronic hepatitis C infection Subjects infection require hospitalization and/or antibiotic treatment 14 day prior Baseline Subjects medical condition judgment investigator could poise unacceptable risk subject compromise interpretation data collect
